articles.author: Leigh Thomas
articles.description: Governments should open a new front in the international clampdown on tax evasion with a global minimum tax on billionaires, which could raise $250 billion annually, the EU Tax Observatory said on Monday.
articles.title: Global billionaire tax could yield $250 billion annually, study says

articles.author: Katya Golubkova
articles.description: Oil prices slid more than $1 on Monday as diplomatic efforts grew over the weekend to contain a conflict between Israel and the Palestinian Islamist group Hamas, amid worries of a wider confrontation in the oil-rich region and pressure on supplies.
articles.title: Oil prices ease as aid convoys arrive in embattled Gaza Strip

articles.author: Archishma Iyer
articles.description: Australia's Treasury Wine Estates (TWE.AX) said on Monday it is well placed to rebuild its business in China, sending its shares up more than 5%, should Beijing's tariffs on Australian wine be removed as signalled by the two countries on the weekend.
articles.title: Australia's Treasury Wine surges on hopes of China revival

articles.author: Heekyong Yang, Soo-Hyang Choi
articles.description: South Korea's Samsung SDI (006400.KS) said on Monday it will supply Hyundai Motor (005380.KS) with electric vehicle (EV) batteries for seven years starting 2026, marking the first battery supply deal between the two companies.
articles.title: Samsung SDI to supply EV batteries to Hyundai Motor starting 2026

articles.author: Sarita Singh, Aditi Shah
articles.description: Japan's Toyota Motor (7203.T) is lobbying the Indian government to cut taxes on hybrid vehicles by as much as one-fifth, arguing they are far less polluting than petrol cars but do not get commensurate policy treatment, a company letter shows.
articles.title: Toyota lobbies India to cut hybrid-car taxes as much as 21% - letter

articles.author: Tom Sims
articles.description: Customers of two Deutsche Bank (DBKGn.DE) units have lodged a surge in complaints with Germany's consumer protection agency, the advocacy group said on Monday, as the banking giant scrambles to make good with aggravated clients.
articles.title: Customers of Deutsche Bank units lodge surge in complaints, consumer group says

articles.author: Nick Carey
articles.description: British electric truck maker Tevva has "re-engaged" with a number of possible merger partners following ElectraMeccanica's (SOLO.O) decision earlier this month to cancel their planned deal and said on Monday it has a number of trucks in production.
articles.title: EV truck maker Tevva 're-engages' with potential merger partners

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose
articles.description: Israel's attacks concentrated on the Gaza Strip's centre and north, Palestinian media reported. A strike on a house near the Jabalia refugee camp, in northern Gaza, killed several Palestinians and wounded others, according to media reports.
articles.title: Israel strikes Gaza, Lebanon overnight; Netanyahu convenes generals

articles.author: Nicolás Misculin, Candelaria Grimberg, Anna-Catherine Brigida
articles.description: Massa had around 36% of the vote, ahead of Milei on just over 30%, while conservative Patricia Bullrich was behind on 23.7% with some 80% of the vote counted, a result that defied pre-election polls that had predicted a libertarian win.
articles.title: Argentina's Peronists seal election run-off with libertarian Milei

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian forces aiming to contain a four-month-old Ukrainian counteroffensive maintained unrelenting pressure on Sunday on the shattered town of Avdiivka in the east and intensified shelling in the southern area of Kherson.
articles.title: Russian forces intensify pressure on Ukraine's Avdiivka, Kherson
